body:
Yeah, that's not a bad, additional idea. I could see allowing this as well. If someone can post some compelling real-world use cases. I could see taking both a block and a class for the concern declaration. But we need some good real-world cases of more advanced usage to justify that.

On Aug 22, 2012, at 9:59 AM, Ernie Miller <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Maybe -- my gut feeling is that since this doesn't break the previous style of usage, at all, it's a net positive.
> 
> I don't have time to write up additional code examples, but I'm thinking that developers of engines may find it useful.
> 
> At the very least, it allows us to intelligently select the controller that handles the comment functionality, without having to use a separate concern, reducing the working vocabulary of the application reflected in the routes file to only the level of detail necessary.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
> 
>
